shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Sinodos (fols. 1ra-182vb) I-1) Index of the Statutes or Commandments (tǝʾǝzazat) of the Apostles (fols. 1ra-2vb) I-2) Statutes or Commandments (tǝʾǝzazat) of the Apostles (fols. 3ra-40vb) I-3) Canons of Simon the Canaanite (n°2) (fols. 41ra-49rb) I-4) Canons of Simon the Canaanite (n°1) (fols. 49va-57rb) I-5) Apostolic Canons: 56 canons (fols. 57va-63ra) I-6) Canons after the Ascension of Our Lord (fols. 63ra-68rb) I-7) Apostolic Canons: 81 ʾabṭǝlisat (n°1) (fols. 68va-77va) I-8) Apostolic Canons: 81 ʾabṭǝlisat (n°2) (fols. 77vb-87ra) I-9) Apostolic Canons: 81 canons (fols. 87rb-91vb) I-10) Letter of Peter to Clement (fols. 92ra-95vb) I-11) Epistle 70 by Cyprian of Carthage (fols. 95vb-97ra) I-12) Melkite Index (fols. 97rb-97vb) I-13) Canons of the Council of Ancyra (fols. 97vb-101vb) I-14) Canons of the Council of Neocaesarea (fols. 101vb-104ra) I-15) Canons of the Council of Gangra (fols. 104ra-105vb) I-16) Canons of the Council of Sardica (fols. 105vb-108vb) I-17) Canons of the Council of Antioch (fols. 108rb-112va) I-18) Canons of the Council of Laodicea (fols. 112vb-119ra) I-19) Canons of the Council of Nicaea (20) (fols. 119rb-123va) I-20) Canons of the Council of Nicaea (84) (fols. 123vb-136vb) I-21) Discourse of the 318 Nicene Fathers on the Right Faith and on the Monastic Life (fols. 137ra-140ra) I-22) Ṣalotä Haymanot “Creed of Nicaea” (fols. 140rb-140vb) I-23) Interpretation of the Ten Commandments by John Chrysostom (fols. 141ra-148ra) I-24) Exposition and admonition on the Role of Our Lord in Our Salvation (also called On the Essence of the Holy Trinity) (fols. 148ra-150ra) I-25) Exposition and admonition on the Way of Virtue and Perdition (also called How to Distinguish between God and Evil) (fols. 150ra-150vb) I-26) Exposition and admonition on the Fear of God (fols. 150vb-155rb) I-27) Exposition and admonition on not Associating with Jews (also called On the Former People of God) (fols. 155vb-163rb) I-28) Exposition and admonition of Gregory of Armenia against the Jews (fols. 163ra-166vb) I-29) Exposition and admonition to Believers on Wise Conduct (fols. 167ra-178ra) I-30) Penitential Canons Given to St. Peter (fols. 178rb-182vb)
Additiones 1-11; colophon.

donors.donor: Additio 6 mentions tǝgre mäkwännǝn ʾAkkälom as the donor.

dcomments.dcomment: Second half of the 15th - mid 16th century (?). Additio 7 refers to the role of King Zärʾa Yaʿqob (r. 1434-68) and Bishop (here called ṗaṗas) Yoḥannǝs in the foundation of the monastery, but it is written in a later hand. The latter arrived to Ethiopia in 1438-39 (bearing the title ʾeṗisqoṗos), together with metropolitans Mikaʾel and Gabrǝʾel (after 1458, there was no bishop in Ethiopia). Cf. S.C. MUNRO-HAY, Ethiopia and Alexandria, vol. 2, Warszawa-Wiesbaden, 2005, pp. 28-36. Additiones 7 and 14 contain references to ʾAbäkäräzun of Gäbrä Gärzän (ca. 1394-1476).

txstates.txstate:
Back board is broken and repaired with a piece of another board and wire rings.
Fols. 1-2 are crudely stitched to the Ms.; Fol. 183 is crudely stitched to the Ms. as an endleaf. Fols. 118-119 are of irregular size. The leather cover is of recent age. Leaves carefully amended: fols. 48, 61, 105, 106, 176.

bindings.binding: Wooden boards (recently) covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Four pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Parchment guards (possibly of the same origin as fol. 183) were used to sew together fols. 1-2.

squires.squire: I(2/2v) — II፩(8/fols. 3r-10v) — ፪III(8/fols. 11r-18v) — ፫IV(8/fols. 12r-26v) — ፬V(8/fols. 25r-34v) — ፭VI(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6 stub after 3/fols. 35r-43v) — ፮VII(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 6; 7, stub after 1/fols. 44r-50v) — ፯VIII(8/fols. 51r-58v) — ፰IX(8/fols. 59r-66v) — ፱X(8/fols. 67r-74v) — ፲XI(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 75r-82v) — ፲፩XII(8/fols. 83r-90v) — ፲፪XIII(8/fols. 91r-98v) — ፲፫XIV(8/fols. 99r-106v) — [፲፬]XV(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 107r-114v) — ፲፭XVI(8/115r-122v) — ፲፮XVII(10/123r-132v) — ፲፯XVIII(8/133r-140v) — [፲፰]XIX(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/ fols. 141r-148v) — ፲፱XX(8/fols. 149r-156v) — ፳XXI(6; s.l.: 3, stub after 4; 4, stub after 3/fols. 157r-162v) — ፳፩XXII(4/fols. 163r-166v) — [፳፪]XXIII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 167r-174v) — ፳፫XXIV(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6 stub after 2/fols. 175r-182v) — <B(1; s.l.: 1, stub after 1/fol. 183r-v)> Fol. 183 originates from a different Ms.

taunit.rl-info: Prickling and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 1ra-182vb + Additions nos. 8, 15. Hand b: fol. 183ra-183vb. Hand c: Additions nos. 1, 3, 4, 5, 9, 11, 13. Hand d: Additions nos. 2, 7, 10. Hand e: Additions nos. 6, 14. Hand f: Addition no. 12.

rubrications.rubrication: Numbers and incipit of canons; incipit of prayers; incipit of texts; elements of the punctuation signs.

edition.text: A. BAUSI, Il Senodos etiopico, canoni pseudoapostolici: Canoni dopo l´Ascensione, Canoni di Simone Cananeo, Canoni Apostolici, Lettera di Pietro, Lovanii 1995 (CSCO 552; SAe 101), 72-115. A. BAUSI, Il Senodos etiopico, canoni pseudoapostolici: Canoni dopo l´Ascensione, Canoni di Simone Cananeo, Canoni Apostolici, Lettera di Pietro, Lovanii 1995 (CSCO 553; SAe 102), 36-50. A. BAUSI, “L´Epistola 70 di Cipriano di Cartagine in versione etiopica”, Aethiopica 1, 1998, 101-130. A. BAUSI, “La versione etiopica della Didascalia dei 318 niceni sulla retta fede e la vita monastic”, in: U. Zanetti - E. Lucchesi (eds.), Aegyptus Christiana, Mélanges d´hagiographie égyptienne et orientale dédiés à la mémoire du P. Paul Devos bollandiste, Genève 2004, 225-248. L. GUERRIER, “Canons pénitentiels”, ROC 21, 1918-19, 5-24, 345-355. L. GUERRIER - S. GREBAUT, “Les canons du concile de Gangresˮ, ROC 3 [23], 1922-23, 303-313. I. GUIDI, “Il canone biblico della Chiesa Copta”, Revue Biblique 10, 1901, 170-172 (canon n°80); G. HORNER, The Statutes of the Apostles or Canones Ecclesiastici, London, 1904, 1-78 (text), 127-227 (trans.); H. LUDOLF, Commentarius ad Historiam Aethiopicam, Frankfurt 1681, 314-328 (Commandments 1-23). P. MAURO DA LEONESSA, “La versione etiopica dei canoni apocrifi del concilio di nicea second I codici vaticani ed il fiorentino”, RSE 2, 1942, 29-89.

desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 1ra, l.1 ( Index of the Statutes or Commandments of the Apostles): In the name of the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Spirit, one God. With the help of God, we begin with the good collection, with the writing of of Sinodos of fathers, the Apostles, which they established for the guidance of the holy Church. The gathering of the Sinodos of the fathers, the chosen Apostles.
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 182vb, l. 25 (Penitential Canons Given to St. Peter:): O bishops, prescribe and legislate the order of penance in this way, so that the sinner does not die in his sins. Give penance to those who want (it), let them repent.
desccontent.details:
I-1) Index of the Statutes or Commandments (təˀəzazat) of the Apostles: fols. 1ra-2vb
I-2) Statutes or Commandments (təˀəzazat) of the Apostles: fols. 3ra-40vb
I-3) Canons of Simon the Canaanite (n°2): fols. 41ra-49rb
I-4) Canons of Simon the Canaanite (n°1): fols. 49va-57rb
I-5) Apostolic Canons: 56 canons: fols. 57va-63ra
I-6) Canons after the Ascension of Our Lord: fols. 63ra-68rb
I-7) Apostolic Canons: 81 ˀabṭəlisat (n°1): fols. 68va-77va
I-8) Apostolic Canons: 81 ˀabṭəlisat (n°2): fols. 77vb-87ra
I-9) Apostolic Canons: 81 canons: fols. 87rb-91vb
I-10) Letter of Peter to Clement: fols. 92ra-95vb
I-11) Epistle 70 by Cyprian of Carthage: fols. 95vb-97ra
I-12) Melkite Index: fols. 97rb-97vb
I-13) Canons of the Council of Ancyra: fols. 97vb-101vb
I-14) Canons of the Council of Neocaesarea: fols. 101vb-104ra
I-15) Canons of the Council of Gangra: fols. 104ra-105vb
I-16) Canons of the Council of Sardica: fols. 105vb-108vb
I-17) Canons of the Council of Antioch: fols. 108rb-112va
I-18) Canons of the Council of Laodicea: fols. 112vb-119ra
I-19) Canons of the Council of Nicaea (20): fols. 119rb-123va
I-20) Canons of the Council of Nicaea (84): fols. 123vb-139vb
I-21) Discourse of the 318 Nicene Fathers on the Right Faith and on the Monastic Life: fols. 137ra-140ra
I-22) Ṣalotä Haymanot “Creed of Nicaea”: fols. 140rb-140vb
I-23) Explanation of the Ten Commandments ascribed to John Chrysostom: fols. 141ra-148ra
I-24) Anonymous Homily on the Role of Our Lord in Our Salvation (also called On the Essence of the Holy Trinity): fols. 148ra-150ra
I-25) Anonymous Homily on the Way of Virtue and Perdition (also called How to Distinguish between God and Evil): fols. 150ra-150vb
I-26) Anonymous Homily on the Fear of God: fols. 150vb-155rb
I-27) Anonymous Homily on not Associating Jews (also called On the Former People of God): fols. 155vb-155rb
I-28) Discourse of Gregory of Armenia against the Jews: fols. 163ra-166vb
I-29) Hortatory Discourse to Believers on Wise Conduct: fols. 167ra-178ra
I-30) Penitential Canons Given to St. Peter: fols. 178rb-182vb.

colophon.det: Written in hand c, cp. also Additiones 1, 4, 8, 10, 12. The note is written over erased punctuation sign.

additional.tran: [Fol. 40vb, l.30] I acquired it (this book), Gäbrä Mädḫən, through the spirit of wisdom.
additional.det: Hand c; cp. also Additiones 2, 4, 8, 10, 12; written over erasure.

additional.tran: [Fol. 40vb, l.32] This book belongs to Däbrä ˁAläma ˁAšir Mätära Däbrä Lozza. Through it, the angels come down, to this place, and they go around it with glory and praise. Paradise is in its middle, fire are its margins.
additional.det: Hand d; s. also Additiones nos. 6, 9.

additional.cont: Fol. 58ra l.15-17: Short praise for Däbrä ˁAläma ˁAšir Mätära.
additional.tran: [Fol. 58ra, l.15-17] Däbrä ˁAläma, which is ˁAšər Mätära, its middle is paradise, its margin is fire.

additional.cont: Fol. 68rb, l.28: Exhortation to the priests to read the book of Senodos.
additional.tran: [Fol. 68rb, l.28] O priests and deacons, do not be idle at reading books, and celebrating the Eucharist for the people on Sabbath-days. I bought this Sinodos, the priest, for the sake of the love of Apostles and for the sake of the love of Mary.
additional.det: Hand a; s. also Additiones 7, 14. The passage is in fact the conclusion of text I-6, but it was turned into an acquisition note a by means of adding ዘተሣየጥክዋ፡ and አነ፡ ካህን፡ (hand c), written over a few erased words.

additional.tran: [Fol. 77va, l.28] Glory be to the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit. I have obtained what I thought of and what I desired, for sanctifying of soul and body;  intelligence is what I need...

additional.cont: Fol. 87ra, l.12: Admonition concerning the canon regulations on the main church feasts and Baptism.
additional.add: Fol. 87ra, l.12: ወኀልቈ፡ በዓላቲሁስ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ዐበይት፡ በዓላት፡ ፱ቱ፡ ጽንሰቱ፡ ልደቱ፡ ግዝረቱ፡ ጥምቀቱ፡ ስቅለቱ፡ ትንሣኤሁ፡ እርገቱ፡ በዐለ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ ደብረ፡ ታቦር፡ ልደተ፡ ሰምዖን፡ ከግዝረት፡ እሩይ። ጥምቀትስ፡ ሕግ፡ መሲሐዊት፡ ወሕግ፡ መንፈሳዊት፡ ጥምቀትስ፡ ለኵሉ፡ ተሠርዓት፡ ለእደው፡ ወለአንስት፡ ኢይትወከፋ፡ እደው፡ አንስተ፡ ወአንስት፡ አደወ፡ ዘውእቱ፡ አባልጅ፡ ወኢይግበሩ፡ ተዋሰቦ፡ ምስለ፡ ዘተሐበዮ፡ አሁሆሙ፡ ወምስለ፡ ዘተርፋ፡ ነገዱ፡ ለነሳኢ፡ ወለተነሣኢ፡ ውጉዝ፡ በቃለ፡ ፲ወ፩ሐዋርያት። ወአንትሙ፡ ካህናት፡ አጥምቁ፡ አንሰተ፡ በ፹ዕለት፡ ወዕደወ፡ በ፵ዕለት፡ ኢታትርፋ፡ ወኢታሕልፋ። ለእመኮነ፡ ጥምቅት፡ በሰኑይ፡ ኢትብልዑ፡ ቅብዐ፡ እለ፡ ብልዑ፡ ዘይትበላዕ፡ በፆም፡ በዕለተ፡ ቀዳሚት፡ ሰንበት።
additional.tran: [Fol. 87ra, l.12] And the number of the feasts of Our Lord is nine great feasts:  His Conception, His Birth, His Circumcision, His Baptism, His Crucifixion, His Resurrection, His Ascension, the feast of the Holy Spirit, Däbrä Tabor. The birth of Simon is equivalent to the Circumcision. Baptism is the Christian law, and the spiritual law. Baptism is established for all, for men and women. The women should not accept the men, and the men (should not accept) the women who are ˀabbaləğ (?). And they should not make marriage with their (god) father who took charge of it, and with the rest of his lineage – neither the one who baptizes, nor the one who is being baptized (?). I t is prohibited by the word of the 12 Apostles.  And you, priests, baptize woman on the 80th day and men on the 40th day.  Do not leave and do not transgress (this regulation). When it is Baptism, do not eat butter on the second day (Monday) but eat what is eaten on fasting days, on the day of the first Sabbath.
additional.det: Hand e; s. also Additio 13. The term ʾabbalǝğ probably refers to god-children of the same god-father.

additional.cont: Fol. 91vc, l.1: Foundation charter of ˀAsir Mätira.
additional.tran: [Fol. 91vc, l.1] This book (is) of təgre mäkwännən ˀAkkälom who delimited the precinct and established as monastery and donated (the book) to St. Mary of ˀAšər Mätəra, which is Däbrä ˁAläma; and he went around with the blowing of the trumpet, together with Bishop (ṗaṗṗas) ˀabba Yoḥannəs whom our King Zärˀa Yaˁqob gave to təgre mäkwännən ˀAkkälom, in the time of ˀabba Yəsḥaq, the abbot, and ˀabunä Abäkäräzun.
additional.det: Hand d; s. also Additiones 2, 9. The note is written in a secondary, later hand 18th or 19th cent. (?).

additional.cont: Fol. 97ra, l.29: Admonition to the priests.
additional.tran: [Fol. 97ra, l.29] O priests and deacons, if you don't teach them each Sabbath day according to this Sinodos, you will descent into the punishment. And you do not be idle at (celebrating) the Mass at Sabbath days!

additional.cont: Fol. 112va, l.24: Supplication of the scribe (?)
additional.tran: [Fol. 112va, l.24] For the sake of the prayer of the Apostles, and for the sake of  the assembly of those Righteous of Faith, and for the sake of all Churches, Christ have mercy upon us on the day of repayment (?) and judgement. Amen and amen.
additional.det: Hand c, cp. also Additiones 1, 3, 4, 10, 12. Similar to Addition 4, this note is written over an erased passage of the original text (by hand a), of which only the last two words were retained ("Amen and amen").

additional.cont: Fol. 112va, l.31:  A list of the monastery's gwəlt-possessions.
additional.tran: [Fol. 112va, l.31] This monastery is the place of saints which is called Däbrä ˁAläma. Its gwǝlt-possessions are (in) Mänbärta, Desˀa (and) Sänˀafe, seven lands. For the commemoration feat, each brings a calf.
additional.det: Hand d; s. also Addition 2, 6; Partly in Amharic.

additional.cont: Fol. 123va, l.26: Supplication.
additional.tran: [Fol: 123va, l.26] The hidden mystery which was revealed by saints [?] and [?], it fill up me with salvation and it does not gives me sadness; and until the arrival of the savior, amen, and of his rule, it [?] me [?] it invite me to the table of Däbrä Ṣəyon, amen.
additional.det: Hand c; s. also add. nos. 1, 3, 5, 8, 12; Written over erased punctuation sign.

additional.cont: Fol. 140va, l.15: Note concerning fasting times.
additional.tran: [Fol. 140va, l.15] First, fast of God and secondly, fast of the salvation, and fourthly, fast of the Apostles and fast of the Prophets, and on the eve of Nativity and on the eve of Epiphany, fast of Nänäwé, if Epiphany is on the second day of the week, the first day, or Sunday, meat and oil will not be eaten but eat what is it eaten during the great fast which started from this cursed rule and averted, as the Apostles said in their Sinodos.

additional.cont: Fol. 140vb, l.11: Unclear note.
additional.det: Hand c; s. also add. nos. 1, 3, 4, 8, 10; Written over erased punctuation signs.

additional.cont: Fol. 140vb, l.14: Foundation charter of Däbrä ˁAläma ˁAšər Mätära.
additional.add: Fol. 140vb, l.14: ንጽሕፍ፡ ሥርዓተ፡ አበው፡ ዘአስተናበሩ፡ አበው፡ ቅዱሳን፡ እለ፡ በደብር፡ ወበአታት፡ በዘመነ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ። ወበዘመነ፡ ጳጳሳቲነ፡ አባ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወአባ፡ ገብርኤል፡ እምአመ፡ ተሐድገ፡ መንበረ፡ ነገሥተ፡ አክሱም፡ ተሐደሰ፡ በ፹ወ፯አመተ፡ ምሕረት፡ በዘመነ፡ ማቴዎስ፡ ወንጌላዊ፡ ጕልታ፡ ሠንአፌ፡ ፲ሀገር፡ መንበርታ፡ ዴስአ፡ ነው፡ አስራት፡ በኵራት፡ ቆብ፡ ብይን፡ ተሰካር፡ ዋርሳ፡ በርሰዋ፡ ይታዘዝ፡ ብለው፡ አውግዘዋል። አሺርመትራ፡ ማዕከላ፡ ገነት፡ ዳሯ፡ እሳት፡ ትኩን፡ ብለው፡ ከመ፡ ኢይግብዑ፡ ሰብ፡ በሥልጣነ፡ አብ፡ ወወል [ድ] ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡ ተጽሕፈ፡ በዘመነ፡ አቡነ፡ አበከረዙን።
additional.tran: [Fol. 140vb, l.14] We copied the ordinances of Fathers set in order by saint Fathers who were in the convent and removed, in the time of our king Zärˀa Yaˁəqob. And in the time of metropolitans ˀabba Mikaˀel and ˀabba Gäbrəˀel, since it was abandoned, the throne of kings of Aksum, it was restored, in the 87th year of mercy [1435 A.D.], during the time of Matewos the evangelist [blank line] The gwult is in Sänˀafe, 10 lands, in Mänbärta and Desˀa, the ˀasrat (…) Ašir Mätəra [blank line] Paradise is in its middle, fire are its margins (...)
additional.det: Hand e; s. also add. no. 5; In red ink; line 10, 16, and partly l. 20 are washed out.

additional.cont: Fol. 166vb, l.27: Scribe's supplication.
additional.add: Fol. 166vb, l.27: ለጸሐፊሃ፡ ስረዩ፡ ወባርኩ፡ ወዘገደፍኩ፡ አርትዑ፡ በቃልክሙ፡ ኦካህናቲሁ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ያብርህ፡ አዕይንተ፡ ልብክሙ። (blank line) ፡ በእንተ፡ ፍቅሮሙ፡ ለሐዋርያት። ወበእንተ፡ ፍቅሮሙ፡ ለአርድእት፡ ይጽሐፍ፡ ስሞ፡ ኀበ፡  ዓምደ፡ ወርቅ፡ በሰማያት።
additional.tran: [Fol. 166vb, l.27] For your scribe, forgive him and bless him, I rejected what they declared right by their voice, O priests of God, He illumines the eyes of your heart [blank line] thanks to the love of the Apostles and thanks to the love of the assistants, he wrote his name near to the golden column in the skies.

drawing.info: Fol. 1r: drawing of a cross; black ink.
Fol. 70r: crude, recent drawing of a symbol; pencil.
Fol. 79v: two crude, recent drawings of the same symbol as in fol. 70r; pencil.
Fol. 80r: crude, recent drawing of the same symbol as in fol. 70r; pencil.
Fol. 85r: crude, recent drawing of a cross; pencil.
Fol. 126v: a drawing of a cross; black ink.
Fol. 129v: recent, elaborated drawing of a cross; pencil.
Fol. 128r: drawing of a cross; pencil.

frames.frame:
Ḥaräg 1-22: fols. 1r, 3r, 41r, 49v, 57v, 63r, 68v, 77v, 87r, 92r, 97r, 101v, 104r, 105v, 108v, 112v, 119r, 123v, 137r, 141r, 155v, 167r.
1) Fol. 1r: wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-1), with three lateral extensions decorated with crosses, reaching the bottom of the text; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page(interlaces, crosses). 2) Fol. 3r: wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-2), with three lateral extensions decorated with crosses, reaching the bottom of the text; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page(interlaces, crosses). 3) Fol. 41r: wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-3), with three lateral pendants reaching l.6 whose the central one decorated with a cross; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page(interlaces, crosses). 4) Fol. 49v: wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-4), with three lateral pendants reaching l.11 for the left side one, l.9 for the central one and l.8 for the right side one, the left and right side ones decorated with a cross; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page(interlaces, crosses). 5) Fol. 57v: wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-5) with four pendants at the corners and two central pendants decorated with a cross, reaching l.5 and reaching the top of the page. The horizontal band extends to the top of the page. Palmettes. 6) Fol. 63r: simple, narrow, coloured (red), horizontal ornamental band in col. a, after l.14, at the incipit of text I.-6) with four pendants at the corners, reaching l.11 and l.19 (interlaces). 7) Fol. 68v: wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-7), with four pendants at the corners, and two central pendants decorated with crosses, reaching l.5 and reaching the top of the page. The horizontal band extends to the top of the page (interlaces, crosses). 8) Fol. 77v: narrow, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. b, at the incipit of text I.-8) with central cross extending to the top of the page (interlaces, crosses). 9) Fol. 87r: narrow, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. b, at the incipit of text I.-9), with central cross extending to the top of the page, and four pendants at the corners, reaching l.5 (interlaces). 10) Fol. 92r: wide, coloured (red and black), simple horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-10) (interlaces). 11) Fol. 97r: narrow, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. b, at the incipit of text I.-12), with central cross extends to the top of the page (interlaces, crosses). 12) Fol. 101v: simple, narrow, coloured (red and black, horizontal ornamental band in col. b after l.21, at the incipit of text I.-14), with four pendants at the corners reaching l.24 and l.18 (interlaces). 13) Fol. 104r: simple, narrow, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band in col. a, after l.11, at the incipit of text I.-15), with four pendants at the corners, reaching l.9 and l.14 (interlaces). 14) Fol. 105v: simple, narrow, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band in col. b, after l. 5, at the incipit of text I.-16), with four pendants at the corners, reaching l.2 and l.8 (interlaces). 15) Fol. 108v: simple, narrow, uncoloured, horizontal ornamental band in col. a, after l.18, after the index of text I.-17), with four pendants at the corners reaching l.15 and l.21. Geometric motifs (interlaces). 16) Fol. 112v: narrow, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. b, at the incipit of text I.-18), with four pendants at the corners reaching l. 4 and reaching the top of the page. The horizontal band extends to the top of the page. Geometric motifs (interlaces, cross). 17) Fol. 119r: narrow, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. b, at the incipit of text I.-19), extending to the top of the page. Geometric motifs (interlaces, crosses, palmettes). 18) Fol. 123v: narrow, coloured (red), horizontal ornamental band over col. b, at the incipit of text I.-20), with four pendants at the corners reaching l.3 and reaching the top of the page. The horizontal band extends to the top of the page. Geometric motifs (interlaces, cross, palmettes). 19) Fol. 137r: wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-21), with four pendants at the corners decorated with crosses, and two central pendants decorated with crosses, reaching l.3 and the top of the page. The horizontal band extends to the top of the page with pairs of ailes. Geometric motifs (interlaces, crosses). 20) Fol. 141r: simple, wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-23). Geometric motifs (interlaces, crosses). 21) Fol. 155v: simple, wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. A-b, at the incipit of text I.-27). Geometric motifs (interlaces). 22) Fol. 167r: wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-29), with three lateral extension whose the central one decorated with a cross, reaching l. 7; The horizontal band extends to the top of the page. Geometric motifs (interlaces, crosses).
